meanings.sent1: The overgrown bushes in the garden were prunable and needed trimming.
meanings.sent2: The prunable branches of the tree were carefully pruned to encourage new growth.
meanings.sent3: The prunable shrubs seemed to be playing hide and seek with the gardener's shears.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like prunable vines, tangled and in need of a good pruning.
meanings.sent5: The concept of time being prunable like a bonsai tree is both fascinating and poetic.

meanings.definition: Able to be trimmed or cut back.
meanings.sent1: The prunable hedges along the fence were neatly trimmed by the landscaper.
meanings.sent2: Gardening experts recommend using prunable plants for easy maintenance.
meanings.sent3: The prunable hair of the doll made it easy for the child to give it a new style.
meanings.sent4: His prunable patience finally reached its limit after waiting for hours.
meanings.sent5: The prunable fabric allowed for easy alterations to the dress design.

meanings.sent1: The prunable roses in the garden bloomed beautifully after a good pruning.
meanings.sent2: The orchard was filled with prunable fruit trees waiting for the pruning season.
meanings.sent3: The prunable bonsai tree looked like a miniature forest waiting to be shaped.
meanings.sent4: Her prunable skills in painting improved after receiving constructive feedback.
meanings.sent5: The prunable attitude of the team made them open to constructive criticism.
